intro: Nicotiana modesta, commonly known as the Mexican nightshade, is a species of flowering plant native to Mexico and Central America. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters. The plant features showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple, often blooming at night. Its leaves are broad, heart-shaped, and covered in fine hairs. Nicotiana modesta is closely related to the tobacco plant and contains nicotine, though it is not typically used for commercial tobacco production.
